title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.2 MIDCH: PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE AND ABUSE IN HOME AND SCHOOL SETTINGS

description.narrative: 2.2 By 2022, children and families have capacity to prevent violence and abuse in home and school settings., which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, girls and boys aged 5-9, especially the most deprived, benefit from healthy, nurturing, protective environments and live free from violence.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.2 By 2022, children and families have capacity to prevent violence and abuse in home and school settings.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to invest efforts in equipping children and families with the knowledge and skills they require to prevent violence in home and school settings through the development of a positive parenting manual and content for the BetterParenting.lk website (+45,000 visitors). A landmark study on bullying and cyberbullying was launched and an advocacy plan was drafted to end corporal punishment. Despite numerous lockdowns and school closures, over 3,000 young people benefitted from evidence-based life skills programming. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:01/02/2022

title.narrative: Country has a functioning, national, multi-sectoral, multi-stakeholder coordination mechanism tasked with overseeing national plans or strategies to prevent and respond to violence against children and adolescents, with child and adolescent participation, Text

actual.value: 2021:Functional multi-sectoral National Monitoring Committee on Child Rights re-established after two years.

title.narrative: Parenting programmes implemented: - Home visiting; - Parent education.(52676), Text

actual.value: 2021:Score 2 Modules are being finalized for parenting programmes. The scope of the parenting manual was expanded to include a facilitators’ guide and the topics of gender and adolescents. The manual will be piloted in Jan 2022.

title.narrative: Life-skills/social development and bullying prevention programmes implemented for children(52678), Text

actual.value: 2021:Score 2 Training of teachers has been completed using online and face-to-face modalities. However, due to COVID-19 the programme could not be fully rolled out in schools. Four constructs have been rolled out in 30 schools.
